p: The rhizomes of ZO were subjected to hydrodistillation and yielded 0.24% ( w/ w) of essential oil with a pale yellowish color and camphoraceous odor. Phytochemicals were characterized using the GC–MS method. The peak numbers were recorded according to the retention time and percentage of each compound ( Table 1). Most constituents were terpenoids, which consisted mainly of 21 monocyclic monoterpenoids and seven sesquiterpenes. Chromatograms showed major components’ identifiable spectra ( Figure 1). The compound present in the highest quantity was zerumbone (24.73%), followed by terpinen-4-ol (18.75%), sabinene (15.19%), and β-pinene (7.95%).
